11#include "rtc_base/file_rotating_stream.h"

13#include <cstdio>
14#include <string>
15#include <utility>
16
17#if defined(WEBRTC_WIN)
18#include <windows.h>
19
20#include "rtc_base/string_utils.h"
21#else
22#include <dirent.h>
23#include <sys/stat.h>
24#include <unistd.h>
25#endif // WEBRTC_WIN

27#include "absl/algorithm/container.h"
28#include "absl/strings/match.h"
29#include "absl/types/optional.h"
30#include "rtc_base/checks.h"
31#include "rtc_base/logging.h"

33// Note: We use fprintf for logging in the write paths of this stream to avoid
34// infinite loops when logging.
35
36namespace rtc {
37
38namespace {
39
40const char kCallSessionLogPrefix[] = "webrtc_log";
41
42std::string AddTrailingPathDelimiterIfNeeded(std::string directory);
43
44// |dir| must have a trailing delimiter. |prefix| must not include wild card
45// characters.
46std::vector<std::string> GetFilesWithPrefix(const std::string& directory,
47 const std::string& prefix);
48bool DeleteFile(const std::string& file);
49bool MoveFile(const std::string& old_file, const std::string& new_file);
50bool IsFile(const std::string& file);
51bool IsFolder(const std::string& file);
52absl::optional<size_t> GetFileSize(const std::string& file);
53
54#if defined(WEBRTC_WIN)
55
56std::string AddTrailingPathDelimiterIfNeeded(std::string directory) {
57 if (absl::EndsWith(directory, "\\")) {
58 return directory;
59 }
60 return directory + "\\";
61}
62
63std::vector<std::string> GetFilesWithPrefix(const std::string& directory,
64 const std::string& prefix) {
65 RTC_DCHECK(absl::EndsWith(directory, "\\"));
66 WIN32_FIND_DATAW data;
67 HANDLE handle;
68 handle = ::FindFirstFileW(ToUtf16(directory + prefix + '*').c_str(), &data);
69 if (handle == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE)
70 return {};
71
72 std::vector<std::string> file_list;
73 do {
74 file_list.emplace_back(directory + ToUtf8(data.cFileName));
75 } while (::FindNextFileW(handle, &data) == TRUE);
76
77 ::FindClose(handle);
78 return file_list;
79}
80
81bool DeleteFile(const std::string& file) {
82 return ::DeleteFileW(ToUtf16(file).c_str()) != 0;
83}
84
85bool MoveFile(const std::string& old_file, const std::string& new_file) {
86 return ::MoveFileW(ToUtf16(old_file).c_str(), ToUtf16(new_file).c_str()) != 0;
87}
88
89bool IsFile(const std::string& file) {
90 WIN32_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DATA data = {0};
91 if (0 == ::GetFileAttributesExW(ToUtf16(file).c_str(), GetFileExInfoStandard,
92 &data))
93 return false;
94 return (data.dwFileAttributes & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DIRECTORY) == 0;
95}
96
97bool IsFolder(const std::string& file) {
98 WIN32_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DATA data = {0};
99 if (0 == ::GetFileAttributesExW(ToUtf16(file).c_str(), GetFileExInfoStandard,
100 &data))
101 return false;
102 return (data.dwFileAttributes & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DIRECTORY) ==
103 FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DIRECTORY;
104}
105
106absl::optional<size_t> GetFileSize(const std::string& file) {
107 WIN32_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DATA data = {0};
108 if (::GetFileAttributesExW(ToUtf16(file).c_str(), GetFileExInfoStandard,
109 &data) == 0)
110 return absl::nullopt;
111 return data.nFileSizeLow;
112}
113
114#else // defined(WEBRTC_WIN)
115
116std::string AddTrailingPathDelimiterIfNeeded(std::string directory) {
117 if (absl::EndsWith(directory, "/")) {
118 return directory;
119 }
120 return directory + "/";
121}
122
123std::vector<std::string> GetFilesWithPrefix(const std::string& directory,
124 const std::string& prefix) {
125 RTC_DCHECK(absl::EndsWith(directory, "/"));
126 DIR* dir = ::opendir(directory.c_str());
127 if (dir == nullptr)
128 return {};
129 std::vector<std::string> file_list;
130 for (struct dirent* dirent = ::readdir(dir); dirent;
131 dirent = ::readdir(dir)) {
132 std::string name = dirent->d_name;
133 if (name.compare(0, prefix.size(), prefix) == 0) {
134 file_list.emplace_back(directory + name);
135 }
136 }
137 ::closedir(dir);
138 return file_list;
139}
140
141bool DeleteFile(const std::string& file) {
142 return ::unlink(file.c_str()) == 0;
143}
144
145bool MoveFile(const std::string& old_file, const std::string& new_file) {
146 return ::rename(old_file.c_str(), new_file.c_str()) == 0;
147}
148
149bool IsFile(const std::string& file) {
150 struct stat st;
151 int res = ::stat(file.c_str(), &st);
152 // Treat symlinks, named pipes, etc. all as files.
153 return res == 0 && !S_ISDIR(st.st_mode);
154}
155
156bool IsFolder(const std::string& file) {
157 struct stat st;
158 int res = ::stat(file.c_str(), &st);
159 return res == 0 && S_ISDIR(st.st_mode);
160}
161
162absl::optional<size_t> GetFileSize(const std::string& file) {
163 struct stat st;
164 if (::stat(file.c_str(), &st) != 0)
165 return absl::nullopt;
166 return st.st_size;
167}
168
169#endif
170
171} // namespace
172
173FileRotatingStream::FileRotatingStream(const std::string& dir_path,
174 const std::string& file_prefix,
175 size_t max_file_size,
176 size_t num_files)
177 : dir_path_(AddTrailingPathDelimiterIfNeeded(dir_path)),
178 file_prefix_(file_prefix),
179 max_file_size_(max_file_size),
180 current_file_index_(0),
181 rotation_index_(0),
182 current_bytes_written_(0),
183 disable_buffering_(false) {
184 RTC_DCHECK_GT(max_file_size, 0);
185 RTC_DCHECK_GT(num_files, 1);
186 RTC_DCHECK(IsFolder(dir_path));
187 file_names_.clear();
188 for (size_t i = 0; i < num_files; ++i) {
189 file_names_.push_back(GetFilePath(i, num_files));
190 }
191 rotation_index_ = num_files - 1;
192}
193
194FileRotatingStream::~FileRotatingStream() {}
195
196bool FileRotatingStream::IsOpen() const {
197 return file_.is_open();
198}
199
200bool FileRotatingStream::Write(const void* data, size_t data_len) {
201 if (!file_.is_open()) {
202 std::fprintf(stderr, "Open() must be called before Write.\n");
203 return false;
204 }
205 while (data_len > 0) {
206 // Write as much as will fit in to the current file.
207 RTC_DCHECK_LT(current_bytes_written_, max_file_size_);
208 size_t remaining_bytes = max_file_size_ - current_bytes_written_;
209 size_t write_length = std::min(data_len, remaining_bytes);
210
211 if (!file_.Write(data, write_length)) {
212 return false;
213 }
214 if (disable_buffering_ && !file_.Flush()) {
215 return false;
216 }
217
218 current_bytes_written_ += write_length;
219
220 // If we're done with this file, rotate it out.
221 if (current_bytes_written_ >= max_file_size_) {
222 RTC_DCHECK_EQ(current_bytes_written_, max_file_size_);
223 RotateFiles();
224 }
225 data_len -= write_length;
226 data =
227 static_cast<const void*>(static_cast<const char*>(data) + write_length);
228 }
229 return true;
230}
231
232bool FileRotatingStream::Flush() {
233 if (!file_.is_open()) {
234 return false;
235 }
236 return file_.Flush();
237}
238
239void FileRotatingStream::Close() {
240 CloseCurrentFile();
241}
242
243bool FileRotatingStream::Open() {
244 // Delete existing files when opening for write.
245 std::vector<std::string> matching_files =
246 GetFilesWithPrefix(dir_path_, file_prefix_);
247 for (const auto& matching_file : matching_files) {
248 if (!DeleteFile(matching_file)) {
249 std::fprintf(stderr, "Failed to delete: %s\n", matching_file.c_str());
250 }
251 }
252 return OpenCurrentFile();
253}
254
255bool FileRotatingStream::DisableBuffering() {
256 disable_buffering_ = true;
257 return true;
258}
259
260std::string FileRotatingStream::GetFilePath(size_t index) const {
261 RTC_DCHECK_LT(index, file_names_.size());
262 return file_names_[index];
263}
264
265bool FileRotatingStream::OpenCurrentFile() {
266 CloseCurrentFile();
267
268 // Opens the appropriate file in the appropriate mode.
269 RTC_DCHECK_LT(current_file_index_, file_names_.size());
270 std::string file_path = file_names_[current_file_index_];
271
272 // We should always be writing to the zero-th file.
273 RTC_DCHECK_EQ(current_file_index_, 0);
274 int error;
275 file_ = webrtc::FileWrapper::OpenWriteOnly(file_path, &error);
276 if (!file_.is_open()) {
277 std::fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open: %s Error: %d\n", file_path.c_str(),
278 error);
279 return false;
280 }
281 return true;
282}
283
284void FileRotatingStream::CloseCurrentFile() {
285 if (!file_.is_open()) {
286 return;
287 }
288 current_bytes_written_ = 0;
289 file_.Close();
290}
291
292void FileRotatingStream::RotateFiles() {
293 CloseCurrentFile();
294 // Rotates the files by deleting the file at |rotation_index_|, which is the
295 // oldest file and then renaming the newer files to have an incremented index.
296 // See header file comments for example.
297 RTC_DCHECK_LT(rotation_index_, file_names_.size());
298 std::string file_to_delete = file_names_[rotation_index_];
299 if (IsFile(file_to_delete)) {
300 if (!DeleteFile(file_to_delete)) {
301 std::fprintf(stderr, "Failed to delete: %s\n", file_to_delete.c_str());
302 }
303 }
304 for (auto i = rotation_index_; i > 0; --i) {
305 std::string rotated_name = file_names_[i];
306 std::string unrotated_name = file_names_[i - 1];
307 if (IsFile(unrotated_name)) {
308 if (!MoveFile(unrotated_name, rotated_name)) {
309 std::fprintf(stderr, "Failed to move: %s to %s\n",
310 unrotated_name.c_str(), rotated_name.c_str());
311 }
312 }
313 }
314 // Create a new file for 0th index.
315 OpenCurrentFile();
316 OnRotation();
317}
318
319std::string FileRotatingStream::GetFilePath(size_t index,
320 size_t num_files) const {
321 RTC_DCHECK_LT(index, num_files);
322
323 const size_t buffer_size = 32;
324 char file_postfix[buffer_size];
325 // We want to zero pad the index so that it will sort nicely.
326 const int max_digits = std::snprintf(nullptr, 0, "%zu", num_files - 1);
327 RTC_DCHECK_LT(1 + max_digits, buffer_size);
328 std::snprintf(file_postfix, buffer_size, "_%0*zu", max_digits, index);
329
330 return dir_path_ + file_prefix_ + file_postfix;
331}
332
333CallSessionFileRotatingStream::CallSessionFileRotatingStream(
334 const std::string& dir_path,
335 size_t max_total_log_size)
336 : FileRotatingStream(dir_path,
337 kCallSessionLogPrefix,
338 max_total_log_size / 2,
339 GetNumRotatingLogFiles(max_total_log_size) + 1),
340 max_total_log_size_(max_total_log_size),
341 num_rotations_(0) {
342 RTC_DCHECK_GE(max_total_log_size, 4);
343}
344
345const size_t CallSessionFileRotatingStream::kRotatingLogFileDefaultSize =
346 1024 * 1024;
347
348void CallSessionFileRotatingStream::OnRotation() {
349 ++num_rotations_;
350 if (num_rotations_ == 1) {
351 // On the first rotation adjust the max file size so subsequent files after
352 // the first are smaller.
353 SetMaxFileSize(GetRotatingLogSize(max_total_log_size_));
354 } else if (num_rotations_ == (GetNumFiles() - 1)) {
355 // On the next rotation the very first file is going to be deleted. Change
356 // the rotation index so this doesn't happen.
357 SetRotationIndex(GetRotationIndex() - 1);
358 }
359}
360
361size_t CallSessionFileRotatingStream::GetRotatingLogSize(
362 size_t max_total_log_size) {
363 size_t num_rotating_log_files = GetNumRotatingLogFiles(max_total_log_size);
364 size_t rotating_log_size = num_rotating_log_files > 2
365 ? kRotatingLogFileDefaultSize
366 : max_total_log_size / 4;
367 return rotating_log_size;
368}
369
370size_t CallSessionFileRotatingStream::GetNumRotatingLogFiles(
371 size_t max_total_log_size) {
372 // At minimum have two rotating files. Otherwise split the available log size
373 // evenly across 1MB files.
374 return std::max((size_t)2,
375 (max_total_log_size / 2) / kRotatingLogFileDefaultSize);
376}
377
378FileRotatingStreamReader::FileRotatingStreamReader(
379 const std::string& dir_path,
380 const std::string& file_prefix) {
381 file_names_ = GetFilesWithPrefix(AddTrailingPathDelimiterIfNeeded(dir_path),
382 file_prefix);
383
384 // Plain sort of the file names would sort by age, i.e., oldest last. Using
385 // std::greater gives us the desired chronological older, oldest first.
386 absl::c_sort(file_names_, std::greater<std::string>());
387}
388
389FileRotatingStreamReader::~FileRotatingStreamReader() = default;
390
391size_t FileRotatingStreamReader::GetSize() const {
392 size_t total_size = 0;
393 for (const auto& file_name : file_names_) {
394 total_size += GetFileSize(file_name).value_or(0);
395 }
396 return total_size;
397}
398
399size_t FileRotatingStreamReader::ReadAll(void* buffer, size_t size) const {
400 size_t done = 0;
401 for (const auto& file_name : file_names_) {
402 if (done < size) {
403 webrtc::FileWrapper f = webrtc::FileWrapper::OpenReadOnly(file_name);
404 if (!f.is_open()) {
405 break;
406 }
407 done += f.Read(static_cast<char*>(buffer) + done, size - done);
408 } else {
409 break;
410 }
411 }
412 return done;
413}
414
415CallSessionFileRotatingStreamReader::CallSessionFileRotatingStreamReader(
416 const std::string& dir_path)
417 : FileRotatingStreamReader(dir_path, kCallSessionLogPrefix) {}
418
419} // namespace rtc
